title: Activity Schema
description: This describes a Bored API activity in JSON format

activity.title: The activity itself
activity.description: Activities should start with a verb in the form of a command (ex. 'Research ...', 'Invite ...', 'Create ...') and be as general as possible, avoiding references to companies or name-brand products.
examples: Learn about a distributed version control system such as Git
Volunteer at your local food shelter

availability.title: How easy is the activity
availability.description: A number between 0 and 1 indicating how easy the activity is for people to do, with 1 being 'most accessible.'

type.title: Type of activity
type.description: Classify the activity as one of these types. Favour more specific categories over less specific ones. Most specific: charity, cooking, music, diy. In the middle: education, social, busywork. Least specific: recreational, relaxation

price.title: Price of the activity
price.description: A number between 0 and 1 that represents how expensive the activity usually is, with 0 being free.

link.title: Link to a URL about the activity
link.description: Any link should be as general as possible. They should not be used to endorse specific sites or products. The primary use is to simply define a term mentioned in the activity (e.g., a specific programming language or item).

key.title: Unique activity ID
key.description: A seven-digit number that uniquely identifies this activity.

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Determines whether the activity is returned by the API.
